name: interpellate
content:
interpellate verb [T]
(ASK QUESTIONS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
politics
  specialized (in a parliament) to formally ask a question of a government minister concerning a matter of policy : The National Assembly is holding a plenary session to interpellate the Justice and Home ministers on the situation relating to prisons.

Politics - general words
interpellate verb [T]
(GIVE IDENTITY)
formal to make someone or something start to exist or to have a particular identity: The child is fully interpellated as a consumer almost before it can articulate a desire.
